N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 922.16 - Washing boilers

State Regulations
(a) Time of
washing. All boilers shall be thoroughly washed as often as the water
conditions require, but not less frequently than once each month. Steam
reservoirs, unless otherwise required, shall be thoroughly washed out at least
once each year. All boilers and steam reservoirs shall be considered as having
been in continuous service between washouts unless the dates of the days that
the boiler or steam reservoir were out of service are properly certified on
washout reports and on the report of inspection. (b) Plugs to be removed. When boilers or
steam reservoirs are washed, all washout, arch, and water-bar plugs must be
removed. (c) Water tubes. Special
attention must be given the arch or water-bar tubes to see that they are free
from scale and sediment. (d) Office
record. An accurate record of all locomotive boiler and steam reservoir
washouts shall be kept in the office of the operator. The following information
must be entered on the day that the boiler or steam reservoir is washed: (1)

No. of locomotive. (2)

Date of washout. (3)

Signature of boiler washer or
inspector. (4)

Statement that
spindles of gauge cocks and water glass cocks and body of gauge cocks where
required were removed and cocks cleaned. (5)

Signature of the boiler inspector or the
employee who removed the spindles and cleaned the cocks. Notes
